channel.title: low on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in low on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Space After Filename
item.description: Detects space after filename

item.title: Setuid and Setgid
item.description: Detects suspicious change of file privileges with chown and chmod commands

item.title: Connection Proxy
item.description: Detects setting proxy

item.title: Cleartext Protocol Usage
item.description: Ensure that all account usernames and authentication credentials are transmitted across networks using encrypted channels. Ensure that an encryption is used for all sensitive information in transit. Ensure that an encrypted channels is used for all administrative account access.

item.title: Group Modification Logging
item.description: Configure systems to issue a log entry and alert when an account is added to or removed from any group assigned administrative privileges. Sigma detects Event ID 4728 indicates a ‘Member is added to a Security Group’. Event ID 4729 indicates a ‘Member is removed from a Security enabled-group’. Event ID 4730 indicates a‘Security Group is deleted’. The case is not applicable for Unix OS. Supported OS - Windows 2008 R2 and 7, Windows 2012 R2 and 8.1, Windows 2016 and 10 Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2000, Windows 2003 and XP.

item.title: Host Without Firewall
item.description: Host Without Firewall. Alert means not complied. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.

item.title: Locked Workstation
item.description: Automatically lock workstation sessions after a standard period of inactivity. The case is not applicable for Unix OS. Supported OS - Windows 2008 R2 and 7, Windows 2012 R2 and 8.1, Windows 2016 and 10 Windows Server 2019.

item.title: External Disk Drive or USB Storage Device
item.description: Detects external diskdrives or plugged in USB devices

item.title: Cisco Collect Data
item.description: Collect pertinent data from the configuration files

item.title: Cisco Discovery
item.description: Find information about network devices that is not stored in config files

item.title: Cisco Stage Data
item.description: Various protocols maybe used to put data on the device for exfil or infil

item.title: Change Default File Association
item.description: When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Service Execution
item.description: Detects manual service execution (start) via system utilities

item.title: Indirect Command Execution
item.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcalua.exe or forfiles.exe

item.title: Windows Network Enumeration
item.description: Identifies attempts to enumerate hosts in a network using the built-in Windows net.exe tool.

item.title: System Owner or User Discovery
item.description: Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.

item.title: Query Registry
item.description: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.

item.title: File or Folder Permissions Change
item.description: Detects file and folder permission changes

item.title: Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null
item.description: Detects overwriting (effectively wiping/deleting) the file

item.title: Systemd Service Reload or Start
item.description: Detects a reload or a start of a service

item.title: Data Compressed
item.description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network

item.title: Data Compressed - Powershell
item.description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network

item.title: Data Compressed - rar.exe
item.description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network

item.title: Local User Creation
item.description: Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn’t happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

item.title: Cmdkey Cached Credentials Recon
item.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials

item.title: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
item.description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

item.title: Net.exe Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Net.exe, whether suspicious or benign.

item.title: Possible Applocker Bypass
item.description: Detects execution of executables that can be used to bypass Applocker whitelisting

item.title: PsExec Service Start
item.description: Detects a PsExec service start

item.title: Quick Execution of a Series of Suspicious Commands
item.description: Detects multiple suspicious process in a limited timeframe

item.title: Scheduled Task Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session

item.title: Suspicious Commandline Escape
item.description: Detects suspicious process that use escape characters

item.title: Taskmgr as Parent
item.description: Detects the creation of a process from Windows task manager

item.title: Usage of Sysinternals Tools
item.description: Detects the usage of Sysinternals Tools due to accepteula key being added to Registry

item.title: Admin User Remote Logon
item.description: Detect remote login by Administrator user depending on internal pattern

item.title: PsExec Tool Execution
item.description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)

item.title: Access to ADMIN$ Share
item.description: Detects access to $ADMIN share

item.title: Download EXE from Suspicious TLD
item.description: Detects executable downloads from suspicious remote systems

item.title: PowerShell Network Connections
item.description: Detects a Powershell process that opens network connections - check for suspicious target ports and target systems - adjust to your environment (e.g. extend filters with company’s ip range')

item.title: Download from Suspicious TLD
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts in suspicious TLDs

item.title: Failed Code Integrity Checks
item.description: Code integrity failures may indicate tampered executables.

item.title: Login with WMI
item.description: Detection of logins performed with WMI

item.title: NTLM Logon
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM, which could be caused by a legacy source or attackers

item.title: USB Device Plugged
item.description: Detects plugged USB devices
